meanings.definition: The city or town that is the official seat of government in a country or region.
meanings.sent1: The capital of our country is where the president lives.
meanings.sent2: Washington D.C. is the capital of the United States.
meanings.sent3: I heard a joke about the capital city, but I forgot the punchline.
meanings.sent4: In the game of chess, the king's safety is of capital importance.
meanings.sent5: Visiting the capital during a national holiday is always exciting.

meanings.definition: Wealth in the form of money or other assets owned by a person or organization.
meanings.sent1: She invested all her capital in the new business venture.
meanings.sent2: The company's capital increased significantly after the merger.
meanings.sent3: I dreamt of swimming in a pool of capital coins last night.
meanings.sent4: His knowledge is his capital in the competitive job market.
meanings.sent5: The entrepreneur risked all her capital to start her own company.

meanings.definition: The most important city or town of a country or region, usually its seat of government and administrative center.
meanings.sent1: Paris is known as the capital of fashion.
meanings.sent2: London is the capital of the United Kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The capital of the land of unicorns is said to be magical.
meanings.sent4: New York City is considered the financial capital of the world.
meanings.sent5: The capital of a country often reflects its culture and history.

meanings.definition: A letter of the alphabet that is written or printed in larger form.
meanings.sent1: The teacher wrote the letter 'A' in capital on the board.
meanings.sent2: When writing a title, remember to capitalize the first letter.
meanings.sent3: I always mix up my lowercase and capital letters in handwriting.
meanings.sent4: The sign was written in bold capital letters to grab attention.
meanings.sent5: The book cover had the title in elegant capital font.
